medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient 1 presented with exaggerated adrenarche and patient 2 with facial hirsutism and primary amenorrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1's symptoms began at age 4 with exaggerated adrenarche. At age 8, he had pubic hair growth and deepening of voice for 12 months. By age 10, he showed further increase in height and obesity, and developed central puberty. Patient 2 experienced excessive facial hair growth for 2 years before being referred at age 14.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has a history of high-normal blood pressure and accelerated bone age. Patient 2 is obese, has high-normal blood pressure, and was premenarchal at the time of diagnosis.
medical_history.family_history: Two affected siblings were identified in Patient 2's family with similar condition.
